results.headline: Splitsville, a Land of Diabolical Lawyers
results.summary_short: The documentary “Divorce Corp.” argues that lawyers and courts collude to make divorces as expensive and drawn-out as possible.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Divorce Corp

results.headline: She’s Hard as Nails, He’s Noir and Nasty
results.summary_short: “Cold Comes the Night” pits a young motel owner against a criminal who takes her and her daughter hostage to recover a fortune in cash.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Cold Comes the Night

results.headline: It’s a Jungle Out There, From Snakes to Mine Monsters
results.summary_short: “Chander Pahar” centers on a Bengali boy who sets out in search of gold and diamond mines and confronts a cave monster.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Chander Pahar

results.headline: The Danish Prince and His Family Drama
results.summary_short: Bruce Ramsay’s “Hamlet” is set in an upper-class, buttoned-down home in postwar London.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hamlet

results.headline: I Remember Mama, the Pot Smuggler
results.summary_short: A mother with two daughters finds work in Florida as a marijuana smuggler, in this semiautobiographical drama written and directed by Shana Betz.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Free Ride

results.headline: Recalling a Disaster Without Uttering a Word
results.summary_short: “The Great Flood” uses music and stark images to tell about the destruction and aftermath of the 1927 Mississippi River flood.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Great Flood

results.headline: Quick, Get the Camera: Fido’s Levitating
results.summary_short: “The Marked Ones,” the fifth film in the “Paranormal Activity” franchise, aims for a new market with the same special effects.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Paranormal Activity: The Marked Ones

results.display_title: In No Great Hurry: 13 Lessons in Life with Saul Leiter
results.headline: Creating Neon Poetry With a Patient Camera
results.summary_short: “In No Great Hurry” follows the photographer Saul Leiter, who created painterly images of New York in color, when black and white still ruled.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of In No Great Hurry: 13 Lessons in Life with Saul Leiter

results.headline: Mob Machinations Crueler Than Pain
results.summary_short: Beat Takeshi is back with “Beyond Outrage,” a sequel to the 2011 “Outrage.”

results.headline: A Cold, Appraising Eye, Spying Treasure
results.summary_short: Geoffrey Rush plays a supercilious auctioneer in Giuseppe Tornatore’s art thriller “The Best Offer.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Best Offer

results.headline: Storm Clouds in the Aura of a Sunny Teenage Pop Star
results.summary_short: At the least, “Justin Bieber’s Believe” is an acknowledgment that the days of pure fluff are over, that Mr. Bieber needs to be understood as both an idol and a target.

results.headline: Home Fires, Acridly Burning
results.summary_short: The word “acting” is inadequate for what the cast of “August: Osage County” is doing. It’s more of a thespian cage match.

results.headline: When Greed Was Good (and Fun)
results.summary_short: Martin Scorsese’s “The Wolf of Wall Street” is three hours full of sex, drugs and conspicuous consumption, but what does it say about us?

results.headline: An Old Flame Shows Up, but Who Invited the Witch and Monsters?
results.summary_short: Keanu Reeves’s presence is not the only Hollywood intrusion into a Japanese legend that is the basis for “47 Ronin.”

results.summary_short: In “The Secret Life of Walter Mitty,” Ben Stiller is an office drone with an active fantasy life.

results.headline: Filling in the Outlines of a Dickens Character, This One Real
results.summary_short: “The Invisible Woman” is about Nelly Ternan and her longtime clandestine affair with Charles Dickens.

results.headline: Soldiers Fighting, but Coping Most of All
results.summary_short: Mark Wahlberg stars as an American soldier in Afghanistan in a film based on Marcus Luttrell’s memoir.

results.headline: Old Resentments Come Up Swinging
results.summary_short: “Grudge Match” teams Sylvester Stallone and Robert De Niro as onetime boxing champions in an unlikely rematch 30 years after their last bout.

results.headline: Combating Criminals With Flash
results.summary_short: In “Dhoom 3,” a circus showman with a grudge against a bank sets off dance moves, bulging muscles and motorcycle maneuvers in a Bollywood crime thriller set in Chicago.

results.headline: Like Simba, Only He’s a Plucky Pachyrhinosaurus
results.summary_short: In the family-friendly film “Walking With Dinosaurs,” computer-generated creatures face conflicts echoing the “Lion King” story.
